intro: Palafoxia leucophylla, commonly known as whiteleaf palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are broad, ovate, and often have a silvery or white underside, giving it its common name.
